notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat JBoss BPM Suite.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of Red Hat JBoss BPM Suite 6.3.3 serves as a replacement for Red Hat JBoss BPM Suite 6.3.2, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes of the patch linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* A security flaw was found in the way Business Process Editor displays the business process details to the user. A remote, authenticated attacker with privilege to create business processes could use this flaw to conduct stored XSS attacks against other users. (CVE-2016-5398)

This issue was discovered by Jeremy Choi (Red Hat Product Security).
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat JBoss BPM Suite security update

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A security flaw was found in the way Business Process Editor displays the business process details to the user. A remote authenticated attacker with privilege to create business processes could use this flaw to conduct stored XSS attacks against other users.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2016-5398 stored XSS in JBoss BPM suite business process editor
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

It is recommended to halt the server by stopping the JBoss Application Server process before installing this update; after installing the update, restart the server by starting the JBoss Application Server process.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2016-5398 stored XSS in JBoss BPM suite business process editor
